user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_irq_register:
```c
int metal_irq_register(int irq,
		       metal_irq_handler irq_handler,
		       void *arg)
{
	struct metal_irq_controller *cntr;
	struct metal_irq *irq_data;

	cntr = metal_irq_get_controller(irq);
	if (cntr == NULL) {
		return -EINVAL;
	}
	if (cntr->irq_register != NULL) {
		return cntr->irq_register(cntr, irq, irq_handler, arg);
	}
	if (cntr->irqs == NULL) {
		return -EINVAL;
	}
	irq_data = &cntr->irqs[irq - cntr->irq_base];
	irq_data->hd = irq_handler;
	irq_data->arg = arg;
	return 0;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function metal_irq_register:
static struct metal_irq_controller *metal_irq_get_controller(int irq)
{
	struct metal_list *node;
	struct metal_irq_controller *cntr;

	metal_list_for_each(&irq_cntrs, node) {
		int irq_base, irq_end;

		cntr = (struct metal_irq_controller *)
		       metal_container_of(node, struct metal_irq_controller,
					  node);
		irq_base = cntr->irq_base;
		irq_end = irq_base + cntr->irq_num;
		if (irq >= irq_base && irq < irq_end) {
			return cntr;
		}
	}
	return NULL;
}
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
irq_data->arg = arg;

```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The assignment irq_data->arg = arg; is reachable. metal_irq_get_controller(irq) returns a controller only when irq is within [irq_base, irq_base + irq_num), so the subsequent index irq - cntr->irq_base is valid. The function returns early only if cntr == NULL, cntr->irq_register != NULL (calls that and returns), or cntr->irqs == NULL; in the path that reaches the assignment none of those conditions hold. Therefore Rule 2.1 (no unreachable code) is not violated for this fragment.
